net.cloud.gfx.elements

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.AbstractElement
      • net.cloud.gfx.elements.Sprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Element, Focusable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TiledSprite

    public class Sprite
extends AbstractElement
    A Sprite is an image being shown in the game. The properties of the image are defined by the image itself, such as transparency. But of course, a sprite can be moved around and changed. This is not for animations, however.

        public static final int PRIORITY
        Default priority of Sprite. Sorta low.

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage image
        The image to draw

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(int id,
              int x,
              int y)
        Create a new Sprite element for showing an image. The shown image will be from the default set and have the default priority.
        Parameters:
        id - The sprite ID
        x - X position
        y - Y position

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(SpriteSet set,
              int id,
              int x,
              int y)
        Create a new Sprite element for showing an image. The shown image will be from the given set and have the default priority.
        Parameters:
        set - The set the sprite is in
        id - The sprite ID
        x - X position
        y - Y position

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(SpriteSet set,
              int id,
              int x,
              int y,
              int priority)
        Create a new Sprite element for showing an image. The shown image will be from the given set and have the given priority.
        Parameters:
        set - The set the sprite is in
        id - The sprite ID
        x - X position
        y - Y position
        priority - The z-priority

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
              int x,
              int y,
              int priority)
        Create a new Sprite element for showing an image. This constructor accepts an actual Image, and so can be used with any image rather than a sprite from the sprite system.
        Parameters:
        img - The image to use for the sprite
        x - X position
        y - Y position
        priority - The z-priority

      • Sprite

        protected Sprite(int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height)
        A constructor for subclasses. Minimally responsible. Sets the given parameters, parent, and priority. Parent is left null and the priority is left as the constant default. Subclasses must set the image on their own.
        Parameters:
        x - X-position
        y - Y-position
        width - Width of the element
        height - Height of the element

    • Method Detail

      • drawElement

        public void drawElement(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        int offsetX,
                        int offsetY)
                 throws IteratorException
        Draw the image to the provided graphics object. The image is drawn where the top left corner is the coordinate to draw from.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object to draw to
        offsetX - How far off on the X axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        offsetY - How far off on the Y axis this element is from the Graphic's origin
        Throws:
        IteratorException - If there was an issue iterating child elements

      • changeImage

        public void changeImage(SpriteSet set,
                        int id)
        Change the sprite being shown. This is done via the sprite system, and may be done when there is no current sprite. This will also update the width and height to be the same as the image's.
        Parameters:
        set - The set the sprite is in
        id - The ID of the sprite

      • changeImage

        public void changeImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
        Change the image being shown. This is done directly via a supplied image. This will also update the width and height to be the same as the image's.
        Parameters:
        img - The image that will be shown
